Sentencas: Mechanical performance analysis is important for ensuring the long-term reliability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: Thermal-mechanical models are constructed to conduct time-dependent mechanical performance analysis of SOFC stack with temperature field obtained by multiphysics modeling.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: The volume-averaged temperature field is used as comparison.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: The creep strains are examined with a time step of 10 h for 10,000 h. It reveals: (1) Uniform temperature significantly decreases the stresses, strains, failure probabilities of all stack components.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: (2) The failure probability of sealant reduced rapidly and the sealant becomes mechanically safer for long-term operation.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: (3) Creep strain is dominant for anode/sealant/interconnect, but negligible for electrolyte/cathode.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: All components are predictably safe against strain failure for 100,000 h (4) Creep strains of stack components interact with each other.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism

Sentencas: Coupled analysis of creep strains of anode/sealant/interconnect is mandatory, but the creep strains of electrolyte/cathode may be neglected for studying mechanical evolutions.
Titulo: Long-term evolution of mechanical performance of solid oxide fuel cell stack and the underlying mechanism
